actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Mr. Martinez moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.
Senate Committee on Labor and Human Resources discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Employment Opportunities.

official_title: To amend title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to establish a revolving fund for use by the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission to provide education, technical assistance, and training relating to the laws administered by the Commission.
short_title: EEOC Education, Technical Assistance, and Training Revolving Fund Act of 1992
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
subjects_top_term: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: EEOC Education, Technical Assistance, and Training Revolving Fund Act of 1992 - Amends the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to establish the EEOC Education, Technical Assistance, and Training Revolving Fund and to pay the cost of providing such services relating to laws administered by the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC). Requires the EEOC to charge fees to offset the costs. Transfers a specified amount to the Fund from the Salaries and Expenses appropriation of the EEOC.

titles.title: EEOC Education, Technical Assistance, and Training Revolving Fund Act of 1992
EEOC Education, Technical Assistance, and Training Revolving Fund Act of 1992

To amend title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to establish a revolving fund for use by the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission to provide education, technical assistance, and training relating to the laws administered by the Commission.
